Position: Part Time Associate Banker Waterfront (30 hours)
Job_Description:
As an Associate Banker, you will be at the forefront of delivering an exceptional customer experience to our clients and potential customers. Acting as the "Face of Chase", you will interact with customers and assist them with all their banking needs. Our Associate Bankers work a rotating schedule, which may include working one weekend day. All Associate Bankers are eligible for Chase's full benefits package including health insurance, paid time off and a track for career growth to Licensed Banker and beyond. 
 
 Unlike a traditional bank teller role, our Associate Bankers contribute significantly to the success of the branch by helping customers. Our Associate Bankers: 
 

Engage clients as they enter the branch by welcoming them and making them feel appreciated, including managing lobby traffic, checking clients into the waiting queue and scheduling/canceling client meetings.
Help clients with everyday transactions such as reordering a debit card, setting up a direct deposit or helping update their address while maintaining established control standards.
Ensure financial transactions are completed accurately and efficiently while complying with all policies, procedures and regulatory and banking requirements.
Educate clients on the usage of technology self-service options such as leveraging the Chase Mobile App, Chase.com, and ATMs to complete their banking needs, whenever, wherever and however they want.
Assist clients and the branch team by helping with new account openings when needed. 
Engage and partner with team members and other lines of business to offer the most appropriate products and tools to help clients meet their financial goals.

 Your ability to learn products, services and procedures quickly and accurately, in addition to working across teams to deliver solutions, will be critical for your success. Showcasing our portfolio of \"One Chase\" products to clients and potential clients will also be a core aspect of your role. 
 Minimum Qualifications 


Minimum 6 months of customer service experience (e.g. Retail, Sales, Financial Services).
High School diploma or GED equivalent required.

Preferred Qualifications


 Has prior experience in financial services, banking, retail or client facing customer service highly preferred.
Demonstrates ability to learn new technologies, products and features, as well as a strong desire to influence, educate and connect customers to technology.
Demonstrates ability to make personal connections, engage customers, and remain courteous and professional in a team environment.
Exudes confidence with clients when sharing product knowledge and solutions.
Has excellent interpersonal communication skills, as well as strong attention to detail and time management.
Remains professional, thorough and organized with strong follow-up skills.
Possesses active listening skills to ensure the best way forward is identified for each customer.
Possesses drive, initiative and knowledge to provide financial options for customers using a consultative approach.


Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America's households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.   We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. 
The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.
 As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.
 We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.
 Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans
 Base Pay/Salary Jersey City,NJ $25.00 - $28.99 / hour; Hoboken,NJ $25.00 - $28.99 / hour

At JPMorgan Chase, we have an obsession for taking care of our customers and employees and making them feel welcomed and valued by building lasting relationships, doing the right thing, exceeding expectations and having a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Using the latest banking solutions, combined with cutting edge financial technology and the most welcoming and friendly service, you'll be front and center representing our brand and culture. Here at Chase, you'll have the opportunity to help people experience our Customer Promise - helping people make the most of their money so they can make the most of their lives, by providing education and advice tailored to suit their financial needs. 
 
 As a Branch Manager, you will ensure the branch will meet and exceed customer expectations and will create a customer obsessed culture in the branch. You will direct all aspects of branch operations, grow the deposits and investments of the branch and coach bankers and tellers. You will also be responsible for creating an environment that influences the use of technology to meet the customers' needs of today and the future. You will collaborate with our partners in Chase Wealth Management, Business Banking and Home Lending to provide a seamless experience for our customers. 
 

Training Requirements 

 Successful completion of the Branch Manager training program is a pre-requisite to be considered active in Branch Manager role. 
 
Responsibilities 

 As a Branch Manager, you will leverage your leadership and communication skills to: 
  


Act as the standard bearer of Chase and create a world-class customer experience 



Partner with Associate Bankers (legacy Tellers) to make every entrance into the branch a warm and welcome one 



Assist bankers and partners in maintaining customer relationships 



Educate clients on how to use our digital platforms to bank and invest when, where and how they want 



Build partnerships with local businesses to build the brand in the local market area through strong community involvement 



Build relationships by promoting a client/customer centered organization and proactively addressing customer needs 



Create an environment that encourages team members to provide an exceptional customer experience and a dynamic and engaging culture 



Address client issues promptly and effectively 



Manage and coach branch employees to engage customers 



Actively identify, coach, develop, motivate, and support employees so that they can provide superior service to every customer 



Work with individual bankers and Associate Bankers (to identify customer needs 



Bring out the best in the branch employees by providing training, coaching, and motivating them to become strong culture carriers and collaborators between all lines of business 



Promote a strong control environment to evaluate, manage and conduct new and existing business by adhering to risk/control expectations, procedures, and processes 



Drive deposits & investments growth for the branch 



Create branch-specific strategies to grow the business 



Use reporting to identify high potential and at-risk customers 



Leverage and understand the generated Branch Scorecard to identify drivers and strategies to be successful 



Partner with bankers in cultivating new and existing deposits 



Create strong partnerships and work with branch partners, including Financial Advisors, Home Lending and Business Banking, to grow deposits and investments 



Improve revenues and expenses and grow the business, while exceeding customer expectations 


Dodd Frank and Safe Act   This position is subject to the Dodd Frank/Truth in Lending Act qualification requirements for Loan Originators. As such, an employment offer for this position is contingent on JPMC's review of your criminal conviction history, credit report, information available through NMLS, and any other information relevant to a determination by JPMC that you demonstrate financial responsibility, good character, and general fitness for the position. Note that any felony conviction within the last seven years will disqualify you from consideration for this position. Your continued employment in this position would be contingent upon compliance with Truth in Lending Act/Dodd Frank Loan Originator requirements. In addition, this position requires National Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLS) registration under the SAFE Act of 2008. As such, upon active employment with JPMorgan Chase, you will be required to either register on NMLS, or to update your existing registration as necessary to grant access to and reflect your employment with JPMorgan Chase. Your continued employment in this position with JPMorgan Chase is contingent upon compliance with the SAFE Act, including successful registration immediately after your start date, and timely completion of annual renewal and required updates thereafter. Any information obtained during the registration, update, and renewal processes or through NMLS notifications may impact your employment with the firm. Any of the completed information you provide during the Chase on-line application process may be transferred, on your behalf, to NMLS by JPMorgan Chase. Please carefully review the information you provide to Chase for accuracy and consistency and with any current NMLS record, if applicable, before submitting. Further information about NMLS and registration requirements of registration can be found at: http://mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org/SAFE/Pages/default.aspx

Position SummaryBanking Relationship Supervisor plays a vital role in ConnectOne’s “People First” banking experience by engaging, and providing adequate support to teammates, in conducting transactions and client interactions to ultimately expand consumer and business banking relationships, cross-serve serve bank products and services, while demonstrating the ConnectOne culture.
Key Responsibilities

Support the Bank’s “People First” focus and rules of engagement—maintaining a professional demeanor, working as an active member of the CNOB team, providing all clients excellent service, always striving to make CNOB “A Better Place to Be”.
Proactively identify opportunities for relationship acquisition and development by cross selling the Bank’s products and services in a consultative manner, based on the uncovered and/or stated needs of the client.
Lead active participation by all teammates in all campaigns and initiatives.
Conduct effective outbound communication with clients to educate and inform.
Supervise and support team members with all operational and service-related functions.
Guide and direct escalated matters appropriately, in the absence of the assigned Business Relationship Manager. Assess performance of the team; reward and recognize strong performers and contribute to the development of an action plan to address performance issues.
Perform account opening for deposit products and educate clients on the Bank’s product and service offerings.
Ensure all activities, transactions and records are in compliance with operational, security and control procedures of the Bank, preventing fraud and protecting customer assets.
Handle client service issues by taking ownership, conducting research, and following up on a daily basis as necessary until full resolution.
Conduct various transactions as needed, including cash handling, at all access points.
Active participation in achieving branch sales/service goals.
Exceed client service expectations professionally, handling all interactions swiftly and effectively.
Supports retail and community events to promote the brand in accordance with the retail business plan.
Responsible for administrative duties for the office.
Supports expense management and overall achievement of Bank and team financial plans and goals.
Create/Maintain work schedules.
Facilitate regular meetings with team to educate and inform.
Performs other duties that may be assigned.

Knowledge

Knowledge of relevant Federal and State banking regulations.
Expert knowledge on the Bank’s deposit and small business lending products and cash management services.
Thorough knowledge of procedures and policies with respect to banking transactions.

Skills

Minimum of one-year CNOB experience one to three years teller experience.
Completed all required training and is fluent in all platform banking functions.
Sales experience or training in sales techniques.

Abilities

Strong “People First” interest and ability.
Effective team building and interpersonal communication abilities are necessary.
ConnectOne Bank culture mastery.

Other Requirements

To support business needs, the ability to work a flexible schedule is required.

Position: Plaintiffs Banking & Finance Law Firm seeking NJ Counsel
Job_Description:
We are a multi-jurisdictional creditors rights firm that manages a caseload of claims on behalf of the largest banks, financial institutions, and insurance companies in the USA. We have multiple openings for Attorneys and legal assistants with specific experience handling credit, contract disputes, post-judgment remedies, document review, and hearing coverage.
Candidates must be able to review, analyze and litigate claims on behalf of some of the largest financial institutions in the USA. Emphasis will be on document review, file resolution and pushing the files swiftly through the litigation process.
Duties and expectations are:

Review all documents and client notes on files, process and note files accordingly
Effectively negotiate resolutions with adverse counsel and pro se defendants
Prepare legal documents and litigate claims, including file review and motion practice

Contact adverse counsel to facilitate settlement
Maintain current task codes on all files to ensure timely processing of files
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively on the phone and in writing
Must be computer proficient; possess excellent communication and organizational skills. Qualified applicants will be trained.
Ability to be a self-starter and work independently

We are seeking to add ambitious, hard-working, motivated players for one of the fastest growing banking law firms in the USA. APPLY TODAY!

About Police and Fire Federal Credit Union (PFFCU)
Police and Fire Federal Credit Union (PFFCU) is a not-for-profit financial institution owned and operated by its members offering higher yields on deposits and lower rates on loans, delivered with personal, responsive service at a level unmatched in the financial services industry. The Assistant Branch Manager supports the Branch Manager with day-to-day operations, provides sales leadership and guidance to staff members. Monitors service and sales quality and mentors staff to achieve goals. The Assistant Branch Manager performs a variety of complex activities to serve members by providing exceptional member service with the highest degree of accuracy and professionalism while fully exploring member needs and recommending appropriate products and services. The Assistant Branch Manager assists with monthly coaching and staff development, annual performance reviews and disciplinary action for staff under the direction of the Branch Manager.
Assistant Branch Manager supports, adopts and promotes our corporate values of member service, teamwork, commitment, performance and professional competency.
Qualifications: 
· Branch Experience Required
· Credit Union Background with Teller Line and Platform Experience Required
· Minimum of 1 year supervisory of staff Required
· Knowledge of Jack Henry Symitar/Episys preferred.

· Demonstrate PFFCU’s core values, promoting our mission and vision.
· Has a thorough and comprehensive understanding of all retail products and services and sufficient understanding of all credit union services to recommend solutions to meet member needs.
· Maintain a comprehensive knowledge on related policies, procedures, rules and regulations.
· Ensures on-going compliance with audit procedures and other applicable guidelines.
· Opens/Closes the branch, adheres to all security procedures during these processes.
· Coaches staff on a regular basis to improve sales/operational skills for the betterment of the staff member, team and credit union.
· Review and Approve Timecards in accordance with labor laws and PFFCU Policy.
· Celebrate success and motivate staff to achieve goals.
· Oversees staff adherence to performance expectations, completing performance improvement plans, verbal/written warnings as needed.
· Execute on short term and long-term strategic goals.
· Monitor Teller and Sales activities to ensure adherence to company policies and procedures.
· Attract, retain, and develop talent to successfully achieve assigned goals.
· Champion a culture of leadership, responsibility, accountability, and continual improvement with all staff members.
· Must obtain Notary designation within 90 days of employment.
· May be required to provide coverage for branches other than the primary branch assigned.
· Perform Other Duti
Supervisory Responsibilities
Under the direction of the Branch Manager, the Assistant Branch Manager supervises assigned staff members – Service and Sales. Provides support, overrides, guidance to staff on member service issues. Coach staff to meet position expectations and sales goals.
Skills/Attributes: 

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent math and accounting skills.
Strong Leadership skills to motivate staff and encourage a learning and growth atmosphere.
Strong problem-solving skills having the ability to solve member service issues as well as workplace conflicts as they arise (staff conflicts or technical difficulties)
Exceptional Member Service skills with both members and staff.
Understanding of banking regulatory matters and procedures for proper operation.
Ability to perform various banking procedures and operations.
Ability to remain professional and composed under pressure.
Proficient with Computers and Various Software systems, including but not limited to Word, Excel, Outlook, Jack Henry Symitar/Episys, etc.

Position: Virtual Banking - Business Analyst II - Jersey City, NJ / Columbus, OH / Tempe, AZ / Plano, TX
Job_Description:
At JP Morgan Chase, we have an obsession for helping and serving our customers, caring for our employees, building lasting relationships, and delivering extraordinary customer experience. We believe in building the best teams by cultivating a culture of diversity and inclusion. Using the latest banking solutions combined with cutting edge banking technology you'll be front and center representing our brand, to offer our customers the best solutions for their financial needs. If you are passionate about people, helping to improve the lives of our customers through financial solutions, education, and advice, then join us at JP Morgan Chase. 
 
 The Virtual Banking team is looking for a strong associate who can take a leadership role in delivering insightful analysis that drives management decisions. The candidate will play a role in sales lead strategy, forecasting, and developing recommendations across a variety of initiatives. This position requires a strong candidate who has extensive analytical and communication skills. The right candidate will have a mix of skills: strong analytics and problem-solving with developed ability to interpret results as well as convey the story in a simple and compelling fashion for our senior leaders. They will be solution-oriented, and able to take data insights and strategy to drive impact. We're looking for someone who has a background in analytics and has the breadth to represent the team on a variety of initiatives. 
 

Job Description 


Conduct detailed analysis, modeling, and forecasting to understand and drive banker performance 
Develop and deliver senior management presentations; incorporating their analysis, knowledge of business and management priorities 
Actively participate in discussion and reviews of analysis/presentations 
Assist in representing the team on initiatives such as testing concepts thru pilots, introducing new leads/activities, etc. 


Qualifications 


2-5 years' business or financial analysis experience (preferably supporting a client-focused environment) 
Strong quantitative and analytical skills. 
Expert in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and executive presentation building skills (Access, Tableau, and other analytical/reporting software a plus) 
Self-starter with the ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced environment with great attention to detail 
Strong critical thinking and capacity to quickly learn and develop new strategic frameworks in a complicated environment 
Well organized with an ability to execute on multiple fronts at the same time 
A team player with a high level of motivation, dependability, and intelligence 
A working understanding of statistics is helpful, but not essential 
An understanding of branch or remote banking is helpful

Position: IT Support Associate II, OpsTech IT
Job_Description:
High School Diploma or equivalent. 1+ year of practice in the set up and installation of computer and networking equipment. 1+ year maintaining laser printers. 1+ year of more of experience in Microsoft Office applications and Windows Operating Systems, Linux, OR Cisco.  Job summary
  About OpsTech IT
  Operations is at the heart of Amazon’s business. We are known for our speed, accuracy, and exceptional service. Our buildings deliver tens of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, every day. OpsTech IT provides nonstop global IT support to Amazon Operations as a vital piece to the puzzle. We are looking for self-motivated individuals to take on new challenges and motivate teams in fostering solutions to the hurdles we face. Together, we take ownership for what we do — whether supporting IT infrastructure, developing new technology in-house, launching a new Amazon Operations facility, or delighting our customers by delivering packages directly to them.
 
 About The Role
  As an IT Support Associate II, you will use your skills to support the operations team in resolving technical problems within an Amazon Operations facility that span across a multitude of technical disciplines. We are committed to improvement; you will be encouraged to participate in career development opportunities as presented to progress your career at Amazon.
  What Do We Offer?
  Amazon offers competitive compensation packages including comprehensive healthcare benefits starting on Day 1, matching 401(k) program, and up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave. But wait there’s more: we don’t wear suits and ties! Come as you are because jeans, t-shirts, sneakers and sometimes a neon safety vest will be your daily outfit.
 
 Responsibilities include, but are not limited to
 

 Allocation, maintenance and troubleshooting of IT equipment used in Amazon Operations facilities.

 Handles support requests and procedures across the network.

 Assist in training new hires.

 Continuous learning of new technologies.

 Ability to support customers from multiple buildings in the area, as well as remote customers.



Ability to move up to 49lbs as well as stand and walk for 10-12 hours at a time with or without reasonable accommodation.





A+, Network +, or other IT industry standard certifications.
 Experience troubleshooting integrated and interdependent computer systems.
 Experience maintaining zebra thermal printers, troubleshooting thin clients, PCs, scanners, and portable handheld terminals.
 Ability to prioritize work based on department and production objectives
 Service Management, Project Management, and Inventory Management skills
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 Ability to work, prioritize and make decisions independently in a fast-paced production environment.

S&P Global Market Intelligence 
Cloud Engineer 

Location: Remote, EST hours required 

GL (For Internal Use Only): 10 

 At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction. 

 The Cloud Engineer will be working on developing and maintaining the corporate messaging infrastructure ensuring message delivery, security, retention, and recoverability of the topics and messages. The role will have opportunities to work on various platforms managed by the team including Kafka, Apigee, Kong and Sonic MQ deployed on Cloud as well as on premise datacenters. The role will also work on on-call support, troubleshooting issues reported by client teams and provide resolutions. 

 Responsibilities 
Work on large scale multi-nodes Kafka clusters residing on AWS and on-prem Datacenters. 
Perform high-level, day-to-day operational maintenance, support, and upgrades for the Kafka Cluster. 
Monitor key performance metrics, measuring the utilization, and overall health of the cluster. 
Research and recommend innovative, and where possible, automate key administration tasks. 
Ability to closely collaborate with application teams on code releases and troubleshooting issues. 
Create topics, setup redundancy cluster, deploy monitoring tools, setup alerts. 
Perform high-level, day-to-day operational maintenance, support, and upgrades for the Kafka cluster 
Work on developing and maintaining API Gateway platforms such as Apigee, Kong and Axway. 
Mandatory skills 
Hands-on experience with Kafka clusters hosted on AWS and on-prem infrastructure. 
Experience in open source or Confluent Kafka, zookeepers, Kafka connect and schema registry. 
Experience in High availability cluster setup, maintenance and ongoing 24/7 support 
Establish best practice standards for configuring Kafka brokers, topics and consumer groups. 
Hands on experience in standing up and administrating Kafka platform from scratch which includes creating a backup & mirroring of Kafka Cluster brokers, broker sizing, topic sizing, h/w sizing, performance monitoring, broker security, topic security, and access management (ACL) 
Ability to concentrate on a wide range of loosely defined complex situations, which require creativity and originality, where guidance and counsel may be unavailable. 
Demonstrate a product mindset with an ability to set forward thinking and direction. 
Good Knowledge on API Gateways such as Apigee and authorization frame works. 
Optional Skills 
Experience in building Kafka pipelines using Terraform, Ansible, and Cloud formation templates 
Experience in setting up Prometheus/Grafana or ELK monitoring tools is a plus. 
Experience as Linux (RHEL) /Unix administrator is huge plus.

Hopewell Valley is hiring a desktop support specialist for a K-12 School District. Looking for a self-driven, motivated, customer focused technician handling end-user support, escalated tickets and all IT aspects. Direct Sysadmin and subject matter expert for 1500+ users, 3000+ devices and 200+ software vendors. Serving as a Tier II / III technician. Knowledge of Microsoft, Google, and networking skills. Ability to mentor others, coordinate projects, and work in a fast paced environment.
Job Requirements: 

Experience is designing, troubleshooting and deploying Windows device images
Experience in creating and deploying software packages for Windows 10
Ability to designing, troubleshooting and deploying Group Policies
Experience in automation and / or scripting
Certifications a plus

Job Description for Desktop Support Specialist: 
QUALIFICATIONS:  2+ years related work experience
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent desirable
Certifications: A+ preferred; OEM certification (Dell, HP) desirable.
Ability to operate effectively in a team environment
Ability to operate with minimal supervision
Ability to anticipate, identify and resolve problems
Ability to communicate effectively technical information both orally and in writing to management, end users, department members and non-technical audiences
Ability to lift and carry up to fifty pounds
REPORTS TO: ADMINISTRATOR OF TECHNOLOGY
Job Goals: 
Responsible for providing district-wide support for Windows and Macintosh systems to minimize downtime and to ensure client satisfaction. Identifies, prioritizes, and resolves desktop and peripheral problems. Activities include recognition, research, problem isolation, resolution, and follow-up. Performs general maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of computer systems and peripherals. Works closely with fellow Technology Department members to design, plan, implement and support district technology to ensure reliable and stable operations.
PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES: 

In order to fulfill his/her professional responsibilities, the Desktop SUPPORT SPECIALIST shall:
Develop, test, document, plan, implement, and maintain district-wide Windows and Macintosh desktop hardware and software requirements, configurations, installations, changes, additions, retirements and re-configurations.
Maintain the highest level of district-wide customer satisfaction by resolving all tangible desktop and peripheral problems and concerns.
Perform routine technical maintenance tasks, troubleshoot and resolve desktop and peripheral problems, and all installations, changes, upgrades and repairs of computers and peripheral equipment.
Research, analyze, and evaluate desktop systems and peripheral performance.
Recommend enhancements to improve performance levels and optimization of systems resources.
Design and/or implement desktop systems restart/recovery procedures.
Recommend or direct corrective actions to be taken to circumvent and/or resolve unanticipated emergencies.
Strive for improvement, and cost-saving avenues in desktop and peripheral technologies.
Design, implement, and maintain desktop systems standards, operational guidelines and specifications.
Coordinate with IT staff, users, and vendors to ensure that malfunctions are repaired in timely and effective manner.
Plan, implement and maintain desktop equipment inventory.
Provide technical assistance to technology staff, desktop users, vendors, etc.
Assist, inform and confer with the Department members on planning, projects, operations and installation activities.
Keep abreast through formal/informal education, seminars, self-study, and other methodologies of advancements in desktop technologies, diagnostics, systems management, peripheral equipment, etc.
Study vendor products and assist in presentations to management related to the purchase and installation of hardware, software, desktop and peripheral equipment.
Prepare progress reports for management and provide data as input to management reporting.
Maintain the privacy and confidentiality of information, protect the assets of the organization, act with ethics and integrity, report non-compliance, and adhere to applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, accreditation and licensure requirements (if applicable), and district policies and procedures.
Perform other duties within the scope of his/her employment and certification as may be assigned.

Company Overview:
 Managed Health Care Associates, Inc. (MHA) is a leading health care services and technology company that offers a growing portfolio of services and solutions to support the diverse and complex needs of the alternate site health care provider. MHA provides expertise in Group Purchasing, Managed Care and Payer Contracting, Reimbursement Management, Specialty Pharmacy Solutions, Pharmaceutical Data Analytics, Clinical Pharmacy Software and Legislative Advocacy. Through the delivery of innovative and targeted health care services and solutions, MHA helps customers increase operational efficiency, maximize business growth, and provide optimum care for patients.


 Job Purpose: 
The Systems Engineer is the most senior technical resource in the Infrastructure & Operations organization. This role will be accountable for enterprise-wide implementation, maintenance, and administration of MHA’s information systems. This is achieved by planning, monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, and optimizing all networked software and associated operating systems & infrastructure. The incumbent in this role will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments. The Systems Engineer provides guidance and expertise to the IT Leadership team on topics including the development of best practices in a variety of areas across the enterprise as required. Acts as a team leader and mentor which provides guidance to colleagues with less experience in systems support, networking, installations, and troubleshooting. Solves problems through analysis of possible solutions using technical experience, judgment, and precedents. The individual in this role is highly proficient within discipline and contributes to organizational objectives.


 Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Manage and supports MHA’s Windows (Active Directory, Group Policy, etc.) infrastructure, VMware vSphere infrastructure, Citrix environment and physical servers
Administer, secure, and support the organization’s cloud environments, including (but not limited to) Office 365, Microsoft Azure, and 3rd party MHA Cloud platforms
Plans and advises team members and IT leadership on the support, capacity planning, and the development of long-term strategic goals for systems and software in conjunction with end-users and department managers.
Collaborate with the Infrastructure & Operations staff to ensure smooth and reliable operation of software and systems for fulfilling business objectives and processes.
Design and deploy new physical and virtual servers, per business and IT requirements
Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure system-related products and services.
Gauge the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems; develop and implement strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.
Design and perform server audits, system backup procedures, and other recovery processes in accordance with MHA’s disaster recovery and business continuity strategies.
Manage end user accounts, permissions, access rights, and storage allocations in accordance with best practices regarding privacy, security, and regulatory compliance.
Oversee in the repair of any hardware issues with vendors and coordination with MHA business
Oversee the upgrading and patching of MHA applications and client/server information systems.
Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.
Assume technical leadership role in problem resolution and root cause analysis.
Serve as escalation point for issues that cannot be resolved by other support tiers or other teams’ support personnel.
Ability to lead and execute small to medium sized projects independently with a previous track record of success.
Manage MHA’s various instrumentation software packages such as PRTG and Netwrix (preferred)
Interface with multiple departments as the subject matter expert resource to assess, recommend, project plan, and implement technology solutions in support of business initiatives
Proactively monitor and report on overall technology service performance and take action to correct deficiencies in monitoring and controlling the quality of individual network services
 Create and maintain technical documentation including systems integrations diagrams, network design diagrams, operational procedures, knowledge base documents, disaster recovery plans and training documentation



 Minimum Qualifications & Competencies:

Experience working as an IT Systems Engineer role in the life sciences space or large enterprise environment 5-7 years of systems engineering experience (relevant certifications preferred such as MCSE,
Bachelor’s degree in information technology or Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent work experience
Ability to manage and maintain multi-tier technical architectures, consisting of application servers, web servers, load balancers, databases, storage, and networking components
Expert knowledge of Windows Server, Active Directory, Group Policy, and related services
Sophisticated knowledge of virtualization infrastructure, especially VMware vSphere/VCenter
Superior understanding of administration of Microsoft cloud services (Office 365, SharePoint Online, Exchange Online, Teams, etc.)
Advanced Experience in the design, implementation, and support of public cloud infrastructure, preferably Microsoft Azure, in a production environment
Microsoft Azure experience, including Azure Active Directory, deploying Azure VM templates and managing Azure VMs, virtual networks, storage, Azure Site Recovery, and other Azure services (Certifications preferred)
Capability with containerization technologies such as Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), serverless Kubernetes, and continuous delivery (CI/CD).
Experience with PowerShell scripting, or other automation tools
Advanced knowledge of core networking concepts including TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, routers, switches, firewalls, load balancing, VLAN segmentation, DMZ, LAN/WAN, Routing, DMARC, etc.
Advanced knowledge of Citrix Duo & XenApps including administration, maintenance, and troubleshooting
Developing and implementing cybersecurity measures and remediation strategies
Excellent understanding of Backup solutions, archival, and enterprise storage solutions
Demonstrate a customer service-oriented attitude, work well under pressure, and possess excellent oral and written communication skills
Extensive wireless familiarity supporting Cisco, Cisco Meraki, or other wireless technologies
Understanding of firewall technologies and the ability to make changes effectively (Palo Alto preferred)
Participate in off hours on call support rotation
Skill using PowerShell or equivalent scripting tools
Understanding and experience with patch/vulnerability remediation

What MHA Offers: 

Competitive salary, including an impressive total rewards and benefits package!
Flexible Paid Time Off, including a hybrid work model, summer hours and at MHA your birthday is a holiday!
Excellent health, dental & vision insurance, with options to fit you & your family’s needs
Your health is important! Our wellness strategy focuses on mental and physical well-being
Casual office dress code – a friendly and welcoming environment
Training & tuition reimbursement program, because continuing to learn matters and we support your development
A dynamic, ambitious, fun work environment

MHA is a growing and evolving service and technology company, and what really makes us unique is our people. Because at our core, we’re a People Powered organization – and our people come first and our culture matters. We’ll help you find a fulfilling career path and encourage you to have a life. Let us be the best place you’ll ever work!


 Apply Now!

 Job Summary

 Job Responsibilities

In support of this model, roles have been categorized into one of four work location categories: onsite roles, hybrid roles that are a blend of onsite and remote work, remote local roles that are primarily home-based but require some level of purpose-driven in-person interaction and living within a commutable distance, and remote non-local roles that can be effectively performed remotely with the ability to work in approved states.
 PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. Our focus on combatting climate change through clean energy technology, our new net zero climate vision for 2030 and enhanced commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion; and supporting the communities we serve make this a particularly exciting time to join PSEG. 



Job Summary


 This is a "Project" position designed to support project work for a limited duration. While the exact duration of the project is yet to be determined, we currently anticipate a period of 3-5 years based on business needs at the present time following which you will separate from the Company. It is important for you to understand that this period may be shortened based on business needs in the future, at which point you will separate from the Company. It is also important for you to understand that this employment is of a limited duration and that you will not be entitled to separation benefits under any PSEG plan at the time you separate from the Company. Director Level approval and waiver will be required for you to bid on other PSEG opportunities within the first 3 years of assignment. From year 4 through the end of your assignment, Director level approval and waiver will not be required. If your assignment ends prior to the anticipated timeframe based on business needs, you will be allowed to bid on other PSEG opportunities without Director level approval from the time you are notified your assignment will be ending through the end date of the assignment. Please note this is a multi-level position in PSE&G's Utility Technologies department. The title and level assigned to the successful candidate will be determined by assessing skills, knowledge, related experience, scope and number of projects managed learned through the interview process.




 Job Responsibilities


 This position is a direct report to a Technology Product Owner in the Smart Operations - Electric Outage and Restoration Management product group. Business Analyst is responsible for business systems and how they align with user needs. Document requirements, establishes scope, objectives and determines strategy for implementing systems to achieve business goals including: gathering and prioritizing customer requirements and working closely with business functions to ensure customer satisfaction goals are met. Primary focus for this position will be the successful implementation of the Energy Strong II Grid Modernization subprogram such as Outage Management System (OMS) and associated advanced storm management tools of the Advanced Distribution Management System (ADMS).




 Job Specific Qualifications


 Responsibilities include:

 Own functional specifications and serve as a functional expert with a deep understanding of business needs on product capabilities by defining business requirements, performing quality assurance & define reporting and alerting requirements
 Help Product Owners in the continuous improvement of their products following Agile product development practices and procedures
 Collaborate with other members of the team and provide foundational support of all Service Now (SN) activities

 Work with internal customers, including Operations and other distribution departments to develop tool requirements to achieve core business functions.
 Work with teams using Amazon Web Services to develop analytics and services supporting Distribution Operations requirements
 Assess and implement third party software solutions, such as OSII ADMS/OMS specifically designed for the restoration management of outages for distribution systems
 Prepare, maintain and administer various reports and systems through MS Office (Word, Excel, Access, Visio, Power Point, Project) as well as SQL, SharePoint and other various analytical AWS programming tools
 Coordinate and facilitate Sprint testing sessions and record testing results accordingly.
 Evaluate existing technology solutions and platforms and provides recommendations for improving productivity and performance
 Collaborate with IT stakeholders such as enterprise architects, software development, operations, cybersecurity and infrastructure to integrate applications and hardware
 Travel to various PSE&G locations may be required

 Required:

 Bachelor’s degree and 2-6 years relevant experience within the information technology field.
 Without a bachelor’s degree, you must have 6-8 years of relevant experience within the information technology field.
 Experience working with a team
 Ability to work independently on most technical issues.
 2+ years business systems analysis experience with proven experience on projects & project teams
 1+ years proven experience with developing testing strategy for large complex projects
 Must maintain and apply working knowledge of PSEG business controls and meet management's expectations for effective internal controls

 Desired Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or Computer Engineering
 Advanced degree, e.g. Masters of Information Technology

   We are currently looking for a results-oriented and dynamic individual to join our team as an IT Operations Engineer. This role is a great opportunity for someone looking to help design and implement a vision from the ground up. These kinds of situations don't come along very often and this role will help to build out and implement the IT infrastructure from the whiteboard to the real world. The IT Operations Engineer will be the overall subject matter expert who will oversee day to day operations across a diverse set of technologies including M365, VDI, Intune, Voice and End User Computing. This key position will help support and grow our technology program working across the organization on a wide variety of projects as we expand.
 


   As the SME own overall day to day IT operations across a diverse set of technologies including M365, VDI, Intune, Voice and End User Computing.
 



     Assist in design and implementation of enterprise solutions
   


     Develop and implement procedures and documentation for ensuring ongoing operations and proactive maintenance of the environment consistent with industry standards
   


     Facilitate the evaluation and selection of software technology and product standards
   


     Perform advanced troubleshooting of complex issues
   


     Reviews and analyzes reporting on ITSM processes and Service Level Agreements to identify inefficiencies and areas where improvements should be made.
   


     Identifies and works to resolve any problems in the service delivery processes.
   


     Provide an escalation point for when service levels are missed or at risk and coordinate resolution of issues with infrastructure, change, and support teams
   


     Complete the projects/improvements/deliverables needed to implement technology, processes, or services to meet requirements including the documentation, testing and implementation.
   


     Infrastructure Project Support & implementation
   


     Demonstrates technical leadership and exerts influence outside of immediate team.
   


     Works with other IT teams for continuous improvement of the overall IT organization.
   


     Effectively collaborate and coordinate across geographically distributed teams
   


     Focus on continuous process improvement and user experience by increasing IT’s value through innovation and emerging technologies
   


     Ensure communication of change implementations and service impacts
   




    QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
  


   The ideal candidate will bring a combination of technology expertise, engineering support and ownership, customer service and solution-oriented mindset together.
 

   In addition, this person should also possess:
 



     2-5+ years of relevant professional experience managing IT Service Delivery preferred.
   


     Strong planning, communication, and organizational skills.
   


     Experience in managing IT infrastructure for a medium-to-large organization
   


     Experience with IT operational stability
   


     Superior customer service orientation and relationship management skills with organizational partners and customers
   


     Ability to identify root-cause issues/improvement opportunities, and design approaches/programs/products to improve overall quality assurance
   


     Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
   


     Strong knowledge of global technologies, including productivity suites, networking, telecom, data center, end-user platforms, and cloud hosting platforms (Azure, AWS, etc.)
   


     Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
   


     Excellent judgment and decision-making
   


     Able to align and work with diverse global stakeholders
   


     Strong humility, listening, creativity, and negotiation skills
   


     Familiarity with LAN/WAN technologies
   


     Deep understanding of IT infrastructure and IT security
   


     Extensive experience in troubleshooting issues
   


     Self-motivated - demonstrates personal drive and ambition, fostering innovation, focusing on delivery to our customers
   


     Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to influence others at all levels
   




    Education
  




     Bachelor’s degree in business or a related field is preferred.

Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.
MS Azure DB Backups and Monitoring
Perform SQL Server Patching
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems
Work with our Network/Security Engineers and Systems Architects on infrastructure projects.
Security and data integrity in a HIPAA compliant organization.

BS or MS in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field
Should have hands 6 to 10 years of experience with database Administration using SQL Server
SQL Server, T-SQL, query optimization tools and techniques, data modelling techniques, and relational database design
Good understanding of the features available in SQL Server to achieve a scalable database solution
Experience architecting and building Data Warehouses, DataMarts
Various database development technologies, such as SQL Server, SQL Replication, Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Warehouse, including SSMS, SSRS, SSIS / or ETL tools, and OLTP/OLAP features
Understanding of data modeling, data lakes, data driven insight, data quality and governance
Strong technical background, analytical, and problem-solving skills are required
Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment and capable of delivering under aggressive timelines
Must possess strong communication and interpersonal skills
Looking for self-motivated candidates who are hands on at their current positions and have hunger to learn new technologies
Able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Capable of incident resolution during major incident process
Good time management and prioritization skills; self-starters especially welcome


Maturity and ability to take responsibility for gathering additional information on requirements and design to effectively establish testing for the applications and processes


Dedicated to excellence in quality, reliability, and thoroughness in all work tasks; detail-oriented with consistent follow-through
Knowledge of emerging technologies
Experience in pharmaceutical industry a plus

Position: Oracle Database Administrator (New Consumer Health Company)
Job_Description:
Johnson & Johnson is currently recruiting an Oracle Database Administrator. This position may be located in Skillman, NJ, or any other Johnson & Johnson Global Consumer Health location. 
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. 
With $82.1 billion in 2020 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. 
If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based healthcare Company, touching the lives of nearly a billion people every day. Our Family of Companies throughout the world compete in consumer, pharmaceutical and medical devices & diagnostics markets and have the skills and resources to tackle the world's most pressing health issues. 
Johnson & Johnson announced plans to separate our Consumer Health business to create a new publicly traded company. The process of the planned separation is anticipated to be completed within 24 months, and it will be subject to legal requirements including consultation with works councils and other employee representative bodies, as required, and other customary conditions and approvals. 
It is anticipated that, following conclusion of the transaction, this position may be conveyed with New Consumer Health. In that case, details of any planned changes would be provided to the successful candidate by New Consumer Health at an appropriate time and would be subject to any necessary consultation processes. 
Role & Responsibilities: 
The Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health Organization, the world’s most comprehensive manufacturer of health care products, has been on an accelerated journey of digital transformation. By leveraging the power of digital technologies and data, we aim to improve the lives of our patients, consumers, & employees and uniquely serve unmet needs. 
This role ensures operational excellence by maintaining a stable, secure, compliant, and highly available database platform. This role requires a mix of strong hands-on technical skills in automation scripting, solution engineering, platform integration, database administration, Agile project management, and communications. The ability to continually adapt, prioritize, and multi-task in a fast-paced environment is paramount 
Key Responsibilities: 

Manage and implement large-scale Database-as-a-Service projects, such as automation scripting and optimization of manual processes, to improve speed-to-market, reduce defects, reduce effort/cost, and drive self-service. This includes the creation of user stories/requirements, iterative design and POC/experimentation, automation coding, and comprehensive & automated testing 


Execute Global I/T Strategic Initiatives and act as a Database Domain Expert (SME) to guide and interact with IT and business partners in cross-sector collaboration 
Perform database design assessments with technical Product Owners to build and deploy standardized database solutions that meet business needs. Understand the overall impact of the application on operations and support 
Complement a high-performance team with your outstanding talents for innovative cloud solutions, while designing and implementing database solutions in AWS, Azure, and traditional IaaS platforms. 
Possess full knowledge of day-to-day operations and see opportunities for improvement, using dashboards and real-time data metrics. Provide guidance to the Managed Service team and 24x7 Level-3 Technical support, on a rotational basis. Drive Root Cause Analysis for problem management and priority incidents, across the full database stack 
Provide input to long-term service vision and technology/service strategies and roadmaps. Perform proof-of-concept experiments with emerging and developing industry technologies and trends to identify potential business value. Publish Service Standards, Guidelines, and Technology Lifecycle Management Roadmaps 


Partner with and evaluate external vendors to influence the capabilities of commercially available products to better meet J&J needs and align to the strategies. Participate in Supplier-Enabled Innovation (SEI) engagements for technologies, providing feedback and recommendations 
Maintain an understanding of J&J sectors, businesses, and products and how they best can deploy the database service to maximize value and achieve corporate goals 
Ensure 100% compliance with all security, regulatory, and quality requirements, and participate in internal and external audits 
Partner with external service providers to provide talent and services to drive high standards 
Drive innovation through automation of services and capabilities 

Qualifications

BA/BS required and a degree in STEM field preferred 
6+ years of relevant technology experience 
Demonstrated experience managing a 24 x 7 global support model 


Demonstrated hands-on Database Administration (Oracle) experience in a large-scale global organization 

At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional, and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work. 
For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com. 
Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Company Intro: Ocean Health Initiatives, Inc. (OHI) is a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) dedicated to providing quality, accessible and comprehensive primary health care to the residents of Ocean and Monmouth County; regardless of economic status.
           Our Health Center Locations: Brick, Freehold, Lakewood, Little Egg Harbor, Manahawkin, Manchester and Toms River; with our school-based Wellness Programs located within the Clifton Ave Grade School, Lakewood; and Lakewood High School.
 OHI services include family and internal medicine, pediatrics, behavioral health, nutrition, OB/GYN women’s health, dental, family planning, specialty care, pharmacies, PrEP, and a STI clinic.

 Position Summary:
 The EMR Specialist is responsible for all OHI staff adoption, onboarding, and management including the integrity and efficiency of the electronic medical records (EMR). They are tasked with analyzing, measuring & increasing practice conversion rates, identifying training gaps, and identifying & launching operational improvement initiatives across the organization. This person should possess an innate talent for data-driven continuous improvement and critical thinking. The Practice Optimization Lead must have the ability to leverage practice performance data and collaborate with clinical teams to optimize operational excellence and patient care quality.

 Responsibilities:

 Serve as the in-house expert for the EMR system and develops best practices to support each EMR initiative.
 Reviews all EMR communications and conveys system challenges and solutions in a timely manner.
 Coordinate efforts to conduct assessments of how current use of the EMR system and identify areas for optimization.
 Collect and analyzes process and EMR data to initiate, develop and implement business practices and procedures that focus on enhanced safety, increased productivity, and reduced cost.
 Research best business practices within and outside the organization to establish benchmark data.
 Manage data driven scorecard to track areas of opportunity, improvement tactics, and optimization KPIs and OKR alignment.
 Analyze quantitative and qualitative data to derive insights and develop corresponding practice improvement plan.
 Consult with the education department to ensure all staff members can use the EMR system to its maximum potential, supports and contributes to strategic initiatives.
 Identify common approaches, such as templates or customized reports that OHI can use to achieve specific aims, such as UDS, MU, PCHMH, HEDIS, etc.
 Develop or enhance educational materials that can assist practice staff in understanding how to best to utilize the EMR system.
 Maintain ongoing communication with practice stakeholders identifying individual and practice developmental needs and collaborates with training team to remediate findings.
 Plans and manages continuous improvement projects
 Reviews system updates, pointing out the advantages, consults with departmental Managers and Operational Leadership to evaluate and develop unique performance plans based on best practice measures.
 Develops and deploys internal practice surveys and communicate results.
 Participates in OHI committees and meetings like CQI, Quality, and EMR.
 Maintains knowledge on the Monday.com platform documenting timely updates on project statuses while meeting assigned deadlines.
 Assist corporate compliance with developing and maintaining thorough and consistent auditing of users and appropriate use of PHI.
 Assures confidentiality, data privacy and user access and maintains consistency in record keeping and reporting.
 Ensures the set up and disabling of user access working with management for maintenance of user security roles and profiles.
 Ensure interfaces and functionality of EMR with external systems and organizations to achieve seamless integration and protection.
 Perform all other duties and special projects as requested by the SVPRC&PM and senior management team.
 Maintains up to date knowledge of computer systems including database management.
 Writes and maintains standard operating procedures (SOP’s).
 Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex EMR.
 Filter, clean, validate, and review EMR data, review reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify and correct problems.
 Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
 Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
 Identifies deficiencies in end user workflows and works with the Director of Education to develop improvement training.


 Requirements:

 Bachelor’s degree in information technology - data management related field is required.
 Must be proficient in SQL.
 2-3 years of applicable EMR experience in the healthcare environment is required. Athena experience preferred.
 Ability to develop and maintain relationships with a strong attention to detail.
 Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
 Must be a highly organized, resourceful, and proactive individual who seeks solutions independently.
 Experience in identity access management, internet security practices, HIPAA and project management preferred.
 Advance knowledge and experience using Microsoft Office Suite statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (i.e. Excel - macros, pivot tables, formulas, etc.)

 The above responsibilities represent those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
 To perform these essential job functions, an employee must be able to meet certain physical and aptitude requirements as described below.
 Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform their essential functions, as required under the Americans with Disabilities Act ("ADA") or other applicable state/local law.

 Physical/Aptitude/Environmental Demands:
 While performing the duties of this job, an employee will generally be required to sit (i) during at least 10 % of their work shift; or (ii) at least 1 hours in an 8-hour shift; and will generally be required to stand (i) during at least 90 % of their work shift; or (ii) at least 7 hours in a 8 hour shift. The employee will be required to walk or ambulate around the office. The employee must have sufficient vision and use their arms, fingers and/or hands to manipulate and use office equipment, including but not limited to, telephones, computers, computer keyboard, and cabinets/drawers. The employee must be able to occasionally lift and carry approximately 10 pounds.
 The employee will be frequently required to stoop, bend, reach, pull, push, kneel and/or crouch, e.g. to retrieve supplies, stock cabinets, prepare an exam room, file records. The employee must be able to communicate in a manner that is understood by patients and other employees. An employee must be able to function and perform their duties while under the inherent stresses of a busy office setting with a high volume of patients.

In this role, you'll join a dynamic Data Solutions team focused on building data management, reporting and analytics solutions for the buy-side. With our Fusion platform, we're taking multi-vendor, multi-disciplinary big data and making it research and ML-ready.
 
 As a data scientist you will engage in analysis of a broad set of datasets for the benefit of internal and external clients. You will build and maintain the data documentation and metadata while collaborating with multiple stakeholders such as the data science, product development and technical teams. This role offers a breadth of growth opportunities in terms of business and technical skills.
 

In this role you will:


Operate on big financial and non-financial data using modern parallel data analytics tools (e.g. Spark)
Utilize the latest cloud technology and infrastructure to perform your analysis at scale
Build and maintain dataset documentation and metadata
Implement rules for programmatic data validation by codifying conventions and/or data relationships
Optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the dataset
Automate repetitive tasks through Python and SQL
Write code that can be maintained and extended by other analysts
Work closely with the data science, product management and data engineering groups
Continuously learn to keep up with industry trends


Core Required Skills


Programming experience in at least one of the commonly used languages for data analysis (e.g., Python, R, MATLAB, Scala).
Knowledge of open source data analysis tools and visualization libraries such as pandas and matplotlib
Functional skills in SQL and other database technologies
Good communication and listening skills
Comfortable in a fast-moving environment with often loosely defined tasks where interaction with multiple stakeholders is required
Attention to detail with strong record-keeping and organizational skills
Passion and motivation for constant learning


Additional skills preferred


Bachelor's degree in an analytical discipline
Experience with tools for large scale and distributed data analysis (e.g., Spark)
Basic understanding of financial markets

Crum & Forster Company Overview: 
 
   Crum & Forster (C&F), with a proud history dating to 1822, provides specialty and standard commercial lines insurance products through our admitted and surplus lines insurance companies. Approaching $4 billion in written premium as of 2021, C&F enjoys a financial strength rating of "A" (Excellent) by A.M. Best. C&F is proud of its superior customer service platform and its claims and risk engineering services are recognized as among the best in the industry. Our most valuable asset is our people - 3000+ employees, and growing, in locations throughout the United States. The company is increasingly winning recognition as a great place to work, earning workplace and wellness awards. C&F is part of Fairfax Financial Holdings, a global organization with $23.8 billion in revenue as of 2021. For more information about Crum & Forster, please visit our website: http://www.cfins.com.
  Job Description:
 

 S&S Data Science team supports the Surplus & Specialty division by providing a broad range of data science services. We participate in an end-to-end Machine Learning development cycle from data extraction and preparation to choosing a modeling methodology, training and evaluating the model to deployment in production on AWS. We work with various external data sources that come in many formats – structured, unstructured text, JSON, XML, documents, and images – to enhance our underwriting and operations models.
 


 We are avidly researching and implementing document digitization methodologies that involve using OCR and NLP. We are innovative and passionate about everything data science related. We are looking for a like-minded individual with strong programming background and desire to learn new skills.
 


 What you will do:


 A Jr Data Scientist will utilize their solid programming skills and assist with building, deploying, implementing and maintaining predictive models and rating algorithms.
 An individual in this role will be familiar with different ways of capturing data including REST APIs and building pipelines for real-time consumption and analysis of external data sources.
 This position provides an excellent opportunity to learn new skills and contribute to other projects that involve OCR, NLP, Deep Learning, and MLOps.


 What you will bring to C&F:



 Required Skills:
 

 Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Math or Statistics
 Experience with Python for programming (variables, logical and mathematical operators, writing and executing programs, conditionals, loops, functions, error handling, file manipulation, etc.)
 Prior experience with querying data stored in Relational Databases (MS SQL Server, MySQL, or PostgreSQL)
 Prior experience with cloud platforms such as AWS



 Desired Skills:
 

 Knowledge of Serverless framework is a plus
 Knowledge of JavaScript (Node.js)
 Experience with DevOps and MLOps
 Familiarity with Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques
 Experience with NoSQL Databases (DynamoDB, OpenSearch)

Competitive compensation package
 Generous 401K employer match
 Employee Stock Purchase plan with employer matching
 Generous Paid Time Off
 Excellent benefits that go beyond health, dental & vision. Our programs are focused on your whole family’s wellness, including your physical, mental and financial wellbeing
 A core C&F tenet is owning your career development, so we provide a wealth of ways for you to keep learning, including tuition reimbursement, industry-related certifications and professional training to keep you progressing on your chosen path

Job_Description:
About ISC Industries
Founded in 1984, ISC Industries Inc is an Automotive Part Manufacturer. Our main brands are Tuff Support for gas struts and Suspensia for chassis parts. Our parts are manufactured in Turkey and we supply a full range of parts for all makes/models from our warehouses in New Jersey.
We are currently seeking a Catalog Analyst to join our team. The primary responsibility of the position will be to analyze and update data based from various sources according to industry best standards. Our offices are locaed in Carlstadt, New Jersey but we are open to remote or hybrid work.
About the Catalog Team
Our Catalog team plays a crucial organizational role within the company. The team is responsible for researching new parts, implementing strategy and roadmap, and defining features for the products and product lines. We manage the data that helps drive the business. Our team’s efforts lead the way to achieving excellent product ranges with up-to-date and accurate information.
Position Summary
As a Catalog Analyst you will be working within the Catalog department but closely with other departments such as Sales and Operations. A passion for working with new data sets, researching car parts, and the technical ability to manipulate and extract data from multiple sources will all help you in this role. As a growing company, we have a lot on our hands so you can expect your work to varying from day-to-day and we encourage feedback and ideas for improvement. We also expect you to do your part in helping to foster effective communication within the office and between departments.
Responsibilities

Researching our parts, new parts, competitor parts, and the market for compatibility, pricing, and applications.


Adding to our database and updating existing data.


Performing tasks on datasets as required for ETL, data mining, normalization, etc.

Requirements

Minimum 1 year experience in Automotive Aftermarket Industry
Knowledge of ACES/PIES and general industry terminology


Must be proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Access and Excel


Knowledge of SQL/Python are both helpful
High attention to detail, organized, and able to work both alone and in a team environment


Must have a work permit in the US

Document and design various processes around DevOps; update existing processes.

 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or equivalent.

Good interpersonal skills and communication with all levels of management.

Familiar with AWS components such as SAM, lambda, API gateway, S3, CloudFront, CloudFormation, EC2, RDS, RedShift, IAM, SSM, Secrets Manager, and DynamoDB.
